title: Bauhaus look-alike?...
content:
Hello all!

Could someone help me identify this font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110220im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sample_c_4543.jpg)

Many thanks for the feedback.

 [‹ ID painted font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110220/http:/typophile.com/node/50173 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font - Any Ideas? Modern Sans ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110220/http:/typophile.com/node/50174 "Go to next forum topic")
author: azuleon

comments.content:
My guess is that it is modified [Bauhaus](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110220/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-bauhaus/), with the terminals rounded. It seems well-made, but it’s still a 33 year old design. Either some looks never go out of style, or there is a failure of imagination (or both?).

- Mike Yanega

Your guess is probably right... And the comments sound very pertinent :-) Fashion also hits typography and also here winds of revival seem to blow — and I’ve seen a renewed wave of interest in the rounded forms of Bauhaus and related cousins... Anyway, many thanks for the feedback.

It’s interesting that you say ’renewed wave of interest’, because I have been doing this ID thing for nine years, and the first [Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110220/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces.html) I made was for Bauhaus-style fonts, because the newsgroups I took part in at the time had requests for these styles all the time. (The earliest version was late 1999)

- Mike Yanega
